title: Math 55
summary: Math 55 is a two-semester long freshman undergraduate mathematics course at Harvard University founded by Lynn Loomis and Shlomo Sternberg. The official titles of the course are Studies in Algebra and Group Theory (Math 55a)[1] and Studies in Real and Complex Analysis (Math 55b).[2] Previously, the official title was Honors Advanced Calculus and Linear Algebra.[3]
